name: SHINRA
tagline: System Hardware Info for R and Analytics
body:
SHINRA is a collection of packages, or meta-package, for R for accessing and understanding various system hardware resources.

* [memuse](https://github.com/shinra-dev/memuse) is a collection of utilities for managing memory information (as multiples of bytes), and accessing system hardware values, such as the amount of system ram.

* [merkhet](https://github.com/shinra-dev/merkhet) is a package for times.  With it you can query system uptimes, process runtimes, and more.

* [okcpuid](https://github.com/shinra-dev/okcpuid) is a simple set of utilities for understanding the current processor.

* [scribe](https://github.com/shinra-dev/scribe) is a set of enhancements and ease-of-use features for the [pbdPAPI](https://github.com/wrathematics/pbdPAPI) package.  This allows users to visualize hardware performance counter data.

* [stressR](https://github.com/shinra-dev/stressR) is a suite of tools for stressing system hardware for benchmarking and testing purposes.  Methods are available for cpu, memory, and hard drives.
